subject: Sales
title: The Pitch That Saved Apple
description: A quick, practical guide to The Pitch That Saved Apple.

hook.text: In 1997, Apple was ninety days from bankruptcy. Jobs pitched a new vision that changed everything.

buildup.text: Jobs didn't discuss specs or margins. He pitched 'Think Different' â€” an identity, not a product line.

discovery.text: The campaign positioned Apple as the brand for creative rebels. Identity outsold features entirely.

twist.text: Jobs was pitching internally first. He had to convince exhausted employees before reaching customers.

climax.text: Apple's rescue proves the right pitch at the right moment can literally save a company from death.

punchline.text: The right pitch at the right moment saves everything.

quiz.question: What made the 'Think Different' pitch revolutionary?
options: It sold an identity and values instead of features
